title: ‘No differences’: What transpired at Siddaramaiah–DKS breakfast meet; key takeaways
content: Karnataka's Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah met to quell speculation of a power-sharing tussle. Both leaders asserted unity, calling reports of a rift "manufactured confusion" and pledging to follow the Congress high command's directives. They emphasized their commitment to local and 2028 elections, vowing to fight the opposition together.

title: Grief turns to shock: Indian-origin bride's Canada 'accident' now murder
content: A permanent resident in Canada, Mandeep Kaur Grewal, initially reported to have died in a car accident, was allegedly murdered by her brother-in-law. Gurjot Singh Khaira has been charged with second-degree murder and indignity to human remains. The family remains in shock, unaware of the motive behind the alleged killing.

title: Ind vs SA: Virat Kohli stuns fans as he poses on MS Dhoni’s iconic RX100
content: Ranchi is buzzing as Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni were spotted together, reigniting fan excitement. New photos show Kohli on Dhoni's iconic Yamaha RX 100 amidst a collection of vintage bikes, and a warm selfie captures their enduring friendship.

title: UP: ‘Drunk’ man found stuck inside leopard trap cage in Bahraich
content: A man in Uttar Pradesh, India, was found trapped inside a leopard cage after reportedly entering it while intoxicated. The incident occurred in Bahraich district, where a leopard had recently killed a villager. Forest officials and police conducted a two-hour rescue operation to free the man, who was later released with a warning. Efforts to capture the leopard continue.

title: Explained: What is the Airbus A320 software issue and why are 6,000 planes grounded
content: Airbus has grounded 6,000 A320 aircraft—half its global fleet—for emergency software fixes after discovering intense solar radiation can corrupt critical flight control systems. The unprecedented recall follows an October incident when a JetBlue flight suddenly nosedived without pilot input, forcing an emergency landing. Airlines worldwide face massive disruptions during peak travel season, with repairs taking hours for most planes but weeks for 1,000 older jets requiring hardware replacements. The incident is being hailed as the largest aircraft recall in history.

title: ‘Miniature-lightning’ detected on Mars: Nasa rover makes rare discovery— new study explains
content: NASA's Perseverance rover has detected 'mini-lightning' on Mars for the first time, capturing faint crackles from dust-driven electrical discharges during storms. These tiny, centimetre-scale sparks, unlike Earth's lightning, were recorded by the rover's microphone, offering compelling evidence of atmospheric electrical activity on the Red Planet. Researchers are eager for further confirmation.

title: IND vs SA: BCCI set to hold crucial meeting on Rohit and Kohli’s ODI future
content: The BCCI is planning a meeting with selectors and team management to discuss Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's future, focusing on the 2027 ODI World Cup. Clarity on their roles and performance expectations will be provided, with advice to play more domestic cricket to maintain match fitness and form.

title: Pune horror: IT firm consultant stabbed during road tiff; cops look for SUV driver, woman
content: A Pune IT consultant was stabbed in the rib after a minor collision between his scooter and an SUV in Kharadi. The SUV driver and a female companion allegedly assaulted the victim following an argument. Police are searching for the duo, with the driver identified and expected to be apprehended soon. The incident occurred Wednesday evening.

title: ‘Staggering damage’: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: Cyclone Ditwah nears TN coast: India on alert as Sri Lanka toll passes 80; IMD issues red alert
content: Cyclonic storm Ditwah, moving slowly, brought rain to south Tamil Nadu and is expected to cause intense showers in northern areas, including Chennai, this weekend. The storm, which caused over 80 deaths in Sri Lanka, is moving parallel to the TN coast, with red and orange alerts issued for heavy rainfall in several districts of Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh.

title: Hong Kong fire tragedy: Were authorities alerted long before? Key details
content: Residents' prior warnings about flammable materials used in renovations at Wang Fuk Court were ignored, contributing to a devastating fire that claimed at least 128 lives. The blaze rapidly spread due to the materials and malfunctioning fire alarms, leading to arrests for manslaughter and corruption as Hong Kong mourns and calls for stronger safety oversight.

title: Oxford Union fiasco: Pak claims false victory after shambolic debate gets cancelled; what happened
content: An Oxford Union debate on India's Pakistan policy was cancelled due to the Pakistan delegation's no-show, leading to accusations of "shambolic management" and the Pakistan High Commission falsely claiming victory. Indian speakers, including J Sai Deepak, were present but refused to debate students instead. The event was marred by last-minute speaker withdrawals and poor communication.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250bn; claims 'we lead industry'
content: Nvidia's stock plummeted by $250 billion after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering significant spending on Google's competing AI chips. This move signals a potential shift in the AI hardware market, with Google's TPUs emerging as a credible alternative to Nvidia's dominant position.

title: 'This is the real GG': R Ashwin reveals the side of Gautam Gambhir critics are ignoring
content: Ravichandran Ashwin highlights Gautam Gambhir's significant impact on India's white-ball cricket, crediting him for fostering a bolder, more proactive T20 approach. Gambhir's coaching, fueled by IPL talent like Abhishek Sharma, has led to recent successes and a redefined team identity, contrasting with Test struggles.

title: Over 300 planes hit: Airbus A320 software snag set to cause major flight disruptions — 10 things to know
content: Airbus has mandated a software upgrade for its A320 family aircraft, impacting over 6,000 planes globally. In India, IndiGo and Air India will ground over 350 planes for two to three days, potentially causing significant flight disruptions. This large-scale recall, one of Airbus's biggest, follows an incident that prompted a software review.

title: Used as 'mule': ED finds Rs 331cr in bike rider's account; money trail leads to viral Udaipur wedding
content: An Enforcement Directorate probe into illegal betting has uncovered a bike-taxi driver in Delhi whose bank account received over Rs 331 crore in eight months. Investigators suspect the account was used as a 'mule' for money laundering, with funds channeled to a luxury wedding linked to a Gujarat politician. The ED is tracing the entire transaction chain.

title: Bo Bichette contract talks pause amid major risks for Toronto Blue Jays
content: MLB analysts are questioning the Toronto Blue Jays' delay in re-signing star Bo Bichette, especially after the team's significant investment in pitcher Dylan Cease. Concerns over Bichette's injury history, including missing substantial time in the 2024 season, are cited as potential reasons for the team's cautious approach to a long-term contract.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note to Stephen days after marriage remarks
content: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.

title: NBA rumors: Lakers eye $186M Bucks star as they plan league’s next superteam
content: Whispers are growing louder about the Los Angeles Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo.  Reports suggest the franchise is exploring aggressive moves to build a future around Luka Dončić, even considering significant short-term sacrifices.  Complex multi-team trade scenarios are circulating, aiming to reshape multiple NBA rosters and create new championship contenders.

title: CBI arrests Assistant Professor in UKSSSC paper leak case: Here is what happened so far
content: Assistant Professor Suman Chauhan was arrested by the CBI for her alleged role in the UKSSSC graduate-level recruitment exam paper leak. Chauhan is accused of solving questions and transmitting answers to a candidate, marking a significant development in uncovering the broader network behind the incident. The leak, which led to the exam's cancellation, has intensified calls for stricter examination safeguards.

title: Rohit & Hardik: Two leadership calls in Agarkar's tenure which were a royal mess
content: Ajit Agarkar’s tenure as chief selector has been marked by dramatic white-ball captaincy shifts, with Rohit Sharma and Hardik Pandya both losing leadership roles. Poor communication, unclear long-term planning, and inconsistent reasoning have fueled discontent within the camp. As India heads into back-to-back ICC events within a year, these bold calls will face their first real test.

title: 'Priority to ...': US pauses visas for all traveling on Afghan passports; move after WH shooting
content: The US has halted visa processing for all Afghan passport holders, citing national security concerns following a shooting incident near the White House. The suspect, an Afghan national who arrived in 2021, critically injured two National Guard members. This move underscores the administration's commitment to protecting Americans amidst ongoing security reviews.

title: ‘Operation Sagar Bandhu’: India flies 12 tonnes of aid to flood-hit Sri Lanka; island battered by Cyclone Ditwah
content: India has launched Operation Sagar Bandhu to aid Sri Lanka following Cyclone Ditwah, which has claimed at least 80 lives. An Indian Air Force C-130J aircraft delivered approximately 12 tons of humanitarian aid, including tents, blankets, and food, to Colombo. This assistance underscores India's commitment to its 'Neighbourhood First' policy and Vision MAHASAGAR amidst the island nation's severe disaster.

title: Delhi schools 2026–27 nursery admission criteria: Proximity leads point system
content: Delhi's private schools are gearing up for 2026-27 nursery admissions, with proximity being the paramount factor in their 100-point systems. Forms release on December 4, with admissions concluding March 19.  Sibling and alumni connections also earn points, while age eligibility remains strict. Parents must navigate varied criteria.

title: No Oppn requests for EVM check or repoll in Bihar: EC
content: The allegations of vote manipulation by opposition parties in Bihar have been thoroughly dismissed by the Election Commission. They confirmed that no requests for EVM verification were logged, and the routine VVPAT audits showed alignment with the official counts.

title: Esha Deol on bond with father Dharmendra: ‘He beautifully managed both families, was a large-hearted man’
content: Following Dharmendra's passing, a prayer meet saw industry heavyweights like Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan pay their respects.  His daughters, Esha and Ahana, have spoken about his ability to manage both his families with grace.  Hema Malini, in a past interview, emphasized her need for his love over material possessions, highlighting his consistent support.

title: Ro-Ko storm loading? Rohit Sharma smashes six, winks at Virat Kohli in Ranchi - See viral pics
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to return for the opening ODI against South Africa in Ranchi, sparking immense fan excitement. Their intense practice sessions, including a viral clip of Rohit's playful wink at Kohli, highlight their camaraderie and competitive spirit. This series is crucial for India to bounce back after their Test series loss.

title: Tere Ishk Mein Opens with Rs 16cr, 2nd biggest romantic film of 2025
content: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishk Mein' has stormed the box office, exceeding expectations with a massive Rs 16.5 crore opening day. This romantic drama's success, fueled by positive reviews and word-of-mouth, marks the highest opener of Dhanush's Bollywood career and signals a strong comeback for intense romantic films. The film's performance is already outshining other releases.

title: No ‘good’ AQI in major cities: 10-year study flags persistent pollution; Delhi tops list
content: A decade-long study reveals no major Indian city met safe air quality standards between 2015 and November 2025. Delhi consistently ranked as the most polluted, with other cities also experiencing unhealthy AQI levels. Vehicular emissions, industrial pollution, and crop burning are identified as key contributors, exacerbated by geographical factors and weather patterns.

title: Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce’s steakhouse photo with Chiefs fans goes viral
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce celebrated an early Thanksgiving dinner at his new steakhouse with family and fans.  Swift even coined a fun nickname for the group. While unable to spend the actual holiday together due to Kelce's game and Swift's security concerns, the pre-holiday meal offered a glimpse into their festive traditions.

title: Kedarnath chopper crash: Report reveals pilot's last words - 'Cannot see anything, turning ...'
content: A pilot's final words, "Cannot see anything, turning…", preceded a fatal helicopter crash near Gaurikund en route to Kedarnath. The Aryan Aviation Bell 407, flying in unpredictable cloud banks, lost visibility and hit a hillside, killing all seven on board. The incident highlights significant weather monitoring shortcomings.

title: South Africa's nightmare? Virat Kohli's record says it all ahead of Ranchi ODI
content: Virat Kohli is set to return for India's ODI series against South Africa, aiming to build on his recent form. He boasts an impressive record against South Africa and at Ranchi specifically. Kohli is also on the verge of a significant international milestone, needing just 337 runs to reach 28,000.

title: Airbus software glitch: 350 AI & IndiGo A320s to be grounded, travel chaos likely this weekend
content: Air travel faces significant disruption this weekend as over 350 IndiGo and Air India A320 family aircraft in India, and thousands globally, are grounded for a crucial software upgrade. This precautionary measure follows an incident where an A320 unexpectedly pitched downward, potentially due to solar radiation affecting flight control data. The upgrade aims to ensure fleet safety.

title: Avoid these 4 foods on empty stomach to reduce gas & bloating
content: Eating certain foods like raw vegetables, tomatoes, citrus fruits, and coffee on an empty stomach can worsen gas, acidity, and bloating. Nutritionist Shweta Shah recommends gentler ways to enjoy these, such as cooking vegetables, combining tomatoes with other foods, having citrus mid-morning, and eating a snack before coffee. Simple morning swaps can significantly improve digestion.

title: Modi-Putin meet on Dec 5: Defence & energy talks in focus; West watches closely
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit India next week for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit, a state visit expected to strengthen defense and trade ties. This visit, Putin's first to India since the Ukraine invasion, will be closely watched by Western nations as India navigates its strategic partnerships.

title: MLB trade rumors: Blue Jays eye $79M Phillies star to strengthen middle order
content: A hypothetical trade sending Kyle Schwarber to the Toronto Blue Jays for Davis Schneider and a pitching prospect is gaining traction. This move would inject much-needed middle-order power into Toronto's lineup, while Philadelphia could gain financial flexibility and younger talent. The deal offers significant offensive upgrades for Toronto and potential long-term roster balance for the Phillies.

title: SC: Will frame rules, menstrual shaming must end, period.
content: The Supreme Court is set to frame guidelines to protect women's health, dignity, and privacy concerning menstruation, prompted by an incident where sanitation workers were forced to prove they were menstruating. The court expressed concern over 'period-shaming' and issued notices to the Centre, acknowledging the SCBA's petition highlighting widespread such violations.

title: GDP grew 8.2% in Q2, fastest in 6 quarters
content: India's economy surged by 8.2% in the July-September quarter, driven by a strong manufacturing rebound and robust services activity. This marks the fastest expansion in six quarters, with domestic demand fueling production ahead of the festival season. Economists now anticipate full-year growth to exceed 7%, bolstered by pro-growth policies and reforms.

title: DC shooting fallout: Trump says he’ll pause ‘Third World migration’ - what it means
content: Following a soldier's death in a terror attack, President Trump vowed to halt immigration from "Third World Countries," initiate mass deportations, and revoke citizenship for those deemed incompatible with "Western Civilization." New USCIS guidelines target 19 nations, including Afghanistan, for stricter green card vetting, marking a significant shift in US immigration policy.

title: Maoists offer to disarm by Jan 1; want ops halted; seek safe reintegration
content: Maoist cadres in Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Chhattisgarh are ready to lay down arms by January 1, 2026, seeking clear security guarantees and a transparent rehabilitation process. The MMC Special Zonal Committee proposes a collective, organized reunification, not individual surrenders, emphasizing safety for cadres and their families. This offer coincides with intensified anti-Maoist operations and a Union government deadline.

title: Liver specialist explains the medicines that should never be mixed with alcohol
content: The cocktail of alcohol and routine medications can create a recipe for disaster—compromising reflexes, burdening the liver, and triggering extreme reactions. Whether it's anti-anxiety meds, sleep enhancers, allergy medicines, or pain relief like paracetamol, the interactions can be harmful. Plus, heart, diabetes, and circulation drugs might also react unpredictably.

title: Trump claims any document signed by Biden using autopen is 'terminated'
content: In a dramatic turn of events, ex-President Donald Trump has announced the invalidation of executive orders issued by Joe Biden via autopen, alleging misuse of the device. Trump has also issued a stern warning of potential perjury accusations against Biden if he maintains that his staff acted under his orders.

title: Utah Mammoth captain Clayton Keller honors late father
content: Utah Mammoth captain Clayton Keller, despite the sudden passing of his father, Bryan, chose to play the very next day against the Dallas Stars. This decision highlights his profound loyalty and inner strength, honoring his father while supporting his team. Coach Andre Tourigny emphasized the organization's unwavering support for Keller, underscoring their family-first approach.

title: DIY abduction fail: Man stages own kidnapping to get ‘rid’ of his pregnant wife; police unravel plot
content: A Lucknow bike mechanic staged his own kidnapping to escape his pregnant wife, paying a minor to deliver a false abduction story. Police uncovered the deception through CCTV footage and surveillance, revealing the man's motive was to 'get rid of her' after frequent arguments.

title: Maharashtra local polls: SC clears election process; 50% cap upheld
content: The Supreme Court has allowed the Maharashtra State Election Commission to proceed with elections for most local bodies, excluding those with over 50% reservation. Polls for 57 civic bodies exceeding this limit will be subject to the court's final decision on January 21, with results pending the outcome.

title: Harshita Brella case: UK police face misconduct proceedings; family demands answers
content: Four Northamptonshire police officers face misconduct proceedings for their handling of domestic abuse complaints made by Harshita Brella before her death. Brella reported abuse by her husband, Pankaj Lamba, who is accused of murdering her and fleeing to India. An investigation found that officers may not have adequately supported Brella, potentially contributing to the tragic outcome.

title: Karnataka State Cricket Association elections: High Court declares K.N. Shanth Kumar’s nomination papers valid for president’s post
content: The order of the court has now set a stage for contest between him and former cricketer Venkatesh Prasad for the KSCA’s top post

title: ECI writes to West Bengal DGP directing police to ensure BLO safety
content: In the letter, the ECI directed the police to ensure that there is “no perceptible atmosphere of fear, threat, and undue influence” on these field functionaries (BLOs) and that no untoward incident occurs at any place

title: India sends 80 NDRF personnel, 21 tonnes relief material to cyclone-ravaged Sri Lanka
content: A C-130 aircraft carrying essential food items and sanitary supplies reached Colombo’s Bandaranaike International Airport at around 1:30 a.m. and was received by the Indian High Commission officials and Sri Lanka Air Force officers.

title: Miraculous escape for 26 after Karnataka bus overturns in Kurnool
content: A few passengers received minor superficial injuries. Police have registered a case and are probing the mechanical failure

title: Airbus A320 software fix LIVE: Asian travel disrupted as carriers scramble to patch software
content: Several countries have reported that the modification on Airbus' A320 jets will cause operational disruptions; DGCA barred airlines from operating Airbus A319, A320, and A321 aircraft until urgent software or hardware modifications

title: Family loses three children to fever within 48 hours in Uttar Pradesh
content: The deaths of the three children in one family set off alarm bells in the Health Department, which has set up a medical camp in the village and launched a probe into the cause of the deaths, the officials said.

title: Karnataka leadership crisis: ‘No differences between us’,  Siddaramaiah, D.K. Shivakumar say after breakfast meet
content: The breakfast meeting that lasted about 40 minutes was convened by the Chief Minister following instructions from the Congress party high command

title: Fire breaks out at Baby Memorial hospital in Kerala’s Kozhikode; no casualties reported
content: Blaze brought under control by Fire and Rescue Services squads within an hour after safe evacuation of patients. Fire caused by suspected short circuit in AC system. No injuries reported

title: Delhi breathes ‘very poor’ air; AQI at 332
content: According to CPCB, an AQI between 0 and 50 is considered “good”, 51-100 “satisfactory”, 101-200 “moderate”, 201-300 “poor”, 301-400 “very poor”, and 401-500 “severe”.

title: Leh violence probe: Term of judicial inquiry to record statements extended by 10 days
content: The commission received a request from the co-chairman of LAB, seeking additional time, citing that “many people still want to give their statements and submit evidence before the commission”

title: In 2026, public holidays in Bengal to add up to over 50 days
content: The day of Mahalaya has been declared a public holiday, and an extra Durga Puja holiday — a Saturday after the festival has long ended — has also been added to the list

title: Five of a family killed in road accident in Kurnool
content: Police said two cars collided head-on after one of the drivers is believed to have dozed off behind the wheel

title: Kerala local body polls: In Kozhikode Corporation, UDF plots a comeback in LDF bastion of half a century
content: With the LDF deciding to cash in on the Corporation’s achievements, the UDF looks to play up the civic body’s  involvement in the 2022 building number scam. The BJP pitches itself as a practical alternative in divisions where it believes voter fatigue exists against both the fronts

title: Kerala local body polls: Sea incursion and tidal flooding shape electoral battle in Chellanam
content: During campaigning, candidates are received by leaflets, put up by the residents, that pose questions on the inaction over the seas incursion situation

title: Kerala local body polls: Tamil Nadu-style electioneering gets popular in Idukki
content: Kanthallur, Vattavada, Marayur, Munnar, Devikulam, Chinnakkanal, Udumbanchola, Vandiperiyar, Peerumade, and Elappara in Idukki mainly uses Tamil for election campaigning of the local body polls in Kerala

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Red alert for Nellore, Chittoor, Tirupati and Annamayya districts on November 30
content: The cyclonic storm Ditwah is expected to weaken into a deep depression on December 1 morning and a depression by the evening, says Cyclone Warning Centre, Visakhapatnam

title: Maharashtra committee on three-language policy to submit final report on December 20
content: Most of those who attended the public consultation expressed the opinion that while Marathi and English should be compulsory, Hindi should be introduced only later

title: Woman shot dead by boyfriend in Noida
content: Police said the accused has been absconding and four police teams have been deployed to search for him

title: Cylcone Ditwah LIVE updates: NDRF deploys teams, provides relief material to Sri Lanka
content: The IMD said the cyclonic storm 'Ditwah' over Sri Lanka coast and adjoining southwest Bay of Bengal has moved slowly northwards

title: Uttarakhand paper-leak case: CBI arrests assistant professor
content: The accused has been identified as Suman, an Assistant Professor at Shaheed Srimati Hansa Dhanai Rajkiya Mahavidyalaya, Agrora (Dhar mandal), Tehri Garhwal

title: A new lease of life under the sun for death row prisoners
content: For the third year in a row, the Supreme Court has not confirmed any death sentences, acquitting nine death row prisoners, commuting five to life imprisonment, and remanding two cases to the trial courts for fresh consideration. Aaratrika Bhaumik reports on those who have been acquitted, and whose stories underline how the justice system can condemn innocent people to death

title: Protests against attacks on CPI(M), Congress offices, leaders in Tripura
content: Both parties have blamed the ruling BJP for the events that have occurred in the wake of days of violence involving cadres of the BJP and its alliance partner, Tipra Motha

title: SIR in Bengal being held under intimidation, ECI must give security to BLOs, says BJP
content: State party chief says oﬃcials involved in exercise forced to take instructions from TMC; asks CEC to visit State to understand the situation created by TMC govt. as CEO is ‘not able to work properly’

title: Call for extension of SIR timeline in Rajasthan
content: Rajasthan civil rights groups urge a six-month extension for the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls to ensure inclusivity

title: Opposing UCC plan, Congress says Assam CM’s days numbered
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera accused the Chief Minister of damaging Assam’s identity and heading “the most corrupt government in the history of independent India”

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear on December 1 pleas for extension of time for registration of Waqf properties
content: According to the mandate of the UMEED portal, details of all registered waqf properties across India are to be mandatorily uploaded within six months

title: Bombay High Court orders audit of construction sites to combat Mumbai’s air pollution
content: The High Court stressed that while Mumbai needs a sustained plan to combat rising pollution, strict compliance with existing guidelines at construction sites can deliver quick results

title: Trinamool, BJP clash over student credit card scheme
content: CM Mamata Banerjee hails milestone as sanctioned loans cross 1 lakh; BJP alleges students caught in a broken system

title: Hindu neighbour offers land to Muslim journalist after Jammu authority demolishes house
content: Kuldeep Sharma, a resident of Jammu’s Narwal, offered land to journalist Arfaz Daing, whose house constructed 40 years ago was demolished by the JDA for “being on encroached land” a day ago

title: Airbus A320 software switch: Flight delays, cancellations likely; over 200 planes impacted
content: Airbus said intense solar radiation might corrupt data critical to flight controls in a significant number of A320 family aircraft and that the software changes required to fix the issue would lead to operational disruptions

title: Around 15 lakh dead voters identified in Bengal so far
content: Meanwhile, 12 electoral roll observers and one special electoral roll observer have been appointed for the scrutiny of the SIR process in West Bengal

title: Dare BJP to suspend MPs for chanting Vande Mataram, says Uddha Thackeray
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief made the statement four days after the Rajya Sabha Secretariat issued a memorandum reminding members to refrain from chanting slogans in the House

title: ED files prosecution complaint against Kashmir couple under PMLA
content: The ED said the accused Abdul Momin Peer purchased a residential property in Srinagar’s Bemina in the name of his wife for a consideration amount of ₹1.5 crore from the proceeds generated from the crime

title: India seals ₹7,995 crore deal with the U.S. for Navy’s MH-60R helicopter fleet support
content: Signing of the contract comes amid strain in ties between the two countries after U.S. President Donald Trump had slapped a whopping 50% tariffs on Indian goods in late August

title: NISAR earth observation satellite enters final science operations phase
content: Images from the satellite can be used in various targeted science and application areas such as agriculture, forestry, geo-sciences, Himalayan snow and oceanic studies

title: Court rejects Choksi’s plea on dropping of FEO charges
content: Mehul Choksi had told the court that since he was in custody for cases pending in India, the application filed by the ED to declare him an FEO deserved to be dismissed

title: Bombay High Court upholds Maharashtra caste verification law for central government employees
content: The High Court rules that Central Government employees availing reservations in Maharashtra must obtain caste validity certificates, declaring the State law constitutional and binding

title: Congress entangled in own struggles, workers unsure of its future: BJP
content: From Karnataka and Bihar to J&K, the Congress is only ‘fighting with itself’, says BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari

title: Anbumani unwilling to share space with Ramadoss in alliance
content: A senior PMK leader, who is privy to the development, says there is no possibility of reconciliation between the father and son before the 2026 Assembly election

title: Anbumani remains president of PMK, Election Commission tells Ramadoss in official communication
content: The poll body advises Dr. Ramadoss’s faction to approach the appropriate party forum or competent court to settle the matter regarding the party’s office-bearers

title: KGMCTA to boycott OP clinics on November 29
content: Treatment for in-patients, conduct of surgeries and all emergency services in the casualty, labour room, and ICU, and emergency surgeries will not be affected by the protest

title: Railways conducts high speed trial on Jolarpettai-Coimbatore line
content: Officials say that the section between Jolarpettai and Coimbatore will be certified fit for operating trains at 130 kmph in the coming months; the increased speed will also improve operational efficiency and ease congestion on the route

title: Pilot initiative: Prasar Bharati to onboard popular regional channels on DD Free Dish
content: Under the scheme, popular regional language channels can apply for allotment of vacant slots on the newly upgraded MPEG-4 streams.

title: Journalists bashed up while reporting on corruption at Indore RTO, seven booked
content: According to the FIR, two journalists were covering an alleged scam on trials for driving licence and the involvement of middlemen at the RTO office

title: Trinamool MLA’s ‘Babri Masjid’ construction claim triggers political row in West Bengal
content: BJP alleges attempt to turn West Bengal into “West Bangladesh” as Murshidabad remarks spark controversy ahead of elections

title: Madras High Court rejects Letters Rogatory issued by district court of Delaware in the United States
content: The issue relates to a patent dispute between American pharmaceutical company Pfizer and Indian pharma major Cipla over the drug Vyndamax

title: Kerala Governor cannot sit on report on V-C postings: SC
content: State tells court that Governor failed to act on a list of names shortlisted by a former SC judge-led committee and forwarded by CM as per SC directive; SC says Governor cannot treat the report as an ‘ordinary piece of paper’

title: Train services hit by locomotive failure at Kalamassery
content: As a precautionary safety measure, train movements on the adjacent main line were temporarily suspended, and services were operated in both directions on the single line, say railway sources

title: Cabinet okays LPS II in Amaravati and ₹7500 crore NaBFID loan for capital infrastructure
content: The approval for LPS II in seven Amaravati villages comes with a broader push to accelerate capital region development, including major infrastructure support measures and reforms cleared by the Cabinet

title: Telangana aspires to emerge as India’s design capital
content: A Centre of Design Excellence to embed design in governance, business and education is proposed to be set up in Hyderabad by 2030 which will support manufacturing and service sectors through design innovation, research and development and communication design

title: ED probes cross-border smuggling network
content: The agency also detected the alleged misuse of Goods and Services Tax credentials belonging to Indians by Myanmar nationals to facilitate the purchase of raw materials.

title: Ma. Subramanian reiterates zero vacancies in Health Department;  nurses association rejects claim
content: The Tamil Nadu Nurses Empowerment Association says 1,500 nursing posts that should be filled through the Medical Services Recruitment Board and around 1,000 contract positions remain vacant

title: SCTIMST launches space medicine centre and bioastronautics fellowship
content: It has also launched the Centre for Skills and Simulation Lab (CSSL) at its Biomedical Technology Wing, Poojappura.

title: Horns state CFP case with 'pretty dominant win'
content: Trailing at the half, No. 16 Texas, backed by a standout effort from quarterback Arch Manning, rallied to defeat rival Texas A&M 27-17, spoiling the No. 3 Aggies' undefeated season and SEC title-game hopes at Darrell K Royal-Texas Memorial Stadium.

title: Bears' win in Philly sends message: 'We're for real'
content: The Bears' 24-15 win over the Eagles went a long way toward legitimizing their surprising run this season, with several players saying they're "changing the culture" after winning nine of their past 10 games.

title: Kiffin to make 'hard decision' on future Saturday
content: Lane Kiffin said he'll decide Saturday whether he will return as Ole Miss' coach in 2026 or take another job, presumably at LSU.

title: Hoosiers roll to 12-0, seal Big Ten title game spot
content: Despite Fernando Mendoza's struggles, No. 2 Indiana rolled to a 56-3 win over rival Purdue, completing the first perfect regular season in school history and clinching a spot in the Big Ten title game.

title: Giannis challenges slumping Bucks to fix 'mindset'
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo spoke at length on a variety of things he felt needed to change for the Bucks, who dropped their seventh straight game Friday night in a 118-109 loss to the Knicks.

title: UGA tops Tech, clinches SEC title berth hours later
content: Georgia coach Kirby Smart said his team would welcome a potential SEC title game berth after the Bulldogs finished the regular season with a win over Georgia Tech.

title: LSU scores 100 for record 7th straight game
content: No. 5 LSU set an NCAA record with its seventh consecutive 100-point game Friday night, routing Marist 113-53 at the Paradise Jam tournament.

title: Keller plays in Utah loss after death of father
content: Utah Mammoth captain Clayton Keller played in Friday night's 4-3 loss to the Dallas Stars, one day after the unexpected death of his father, and as a tribute, the 27-year-old forward was named the game's first star at the American Airlines Center.

title: WWE Survivor Series: Key stats and info to know before WarGames
content: As we approach Saturday's WWE premium live event, let's catch up on some notes and stats for each match.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Magic, Thunder secure top seeds
content: The 2025 NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament.

title: 37 games with postseason implications to fill your Rivalry Week menu
content: As if the intensity of rival games weren't enough, there are high stakes everywhere you look this weekend.

title: Inside weird and wonderful college football rivalry trophies
content: What do an axe, skillet and a gold boot have in common? Meet the iconic rivalry trophies of college football.

title: Our guide to remaining Week 13 NFL games: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: The Browns and Shedeur Sanders hosting the Niners? Sam Darnold playing his old Vikings team? We have picks, predictions and stats for every Week 13 game.

title: Week 13 buzz: What we're hearing on the struggling Bucs, Pickens' next deal, more
content: Are the Bucs worried about their losing streak? Will the Cowboys extend George Pickens? Here's the latest intel.

title: 'Not just waiting around for Paul and Joel': NBA scouts, execs on what's next in Philly
content: What is the 76ers' ceiling? How good is the Maxey-Edgecombe duo? We talked to league insiders about the new era in Philly.

title: How Tyrese Maxey went from the hardwood to the 2025 National Dog Show
content: Maxey recently ran two dogs through the Purina Pro Plan Incredible Dog Challenge Agility Show in Philadelphia.

title: Which NFL players are the best (and worst) locker room DJs? What music do they play?
content: The key to a good DJ is understanding the room's vibe and being versatile -- and not always playing NBA YoungBoy.

title: Repeating as Premier League champions is hard -- as Liverpool are finding out
content: Liverpool's collapse is part of a common trend of Premier League champions struggling to keep up their form the next season. Why is that?

title: Germany's missed chances open up Nations League final vs. Spain
content: Tuesday will be the decider for the title, but Germany missed a chance in their first leg against Spain.

title: Conference finals preview: Can Müller lead the Caps to MLS Cup?
content: The MLS postseason is down to four teams, with Lionel Messi and Thomas Müller providing plenty of star power, but will it be enough to get to MLS Cup?

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What happens if there's no deal at the end of the 30 days?
content: How far apart are the two sides and what if a deal isn't in place by the Sunday WNBA deadline for a new CBA?

title: Oregon, Ole Miss and Virginia headline best Week 14 uniforms in college football
content: Oregon has a typically colorful look while Virginia will be donning throwbacks, among other sleek threads from across the regular season's final week.

title: 23XI vs. NASCAR trial: Why Michael Jordan & Co. want to tear up stock car racing
content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barça to prioritize in defense and attack in summer
content: Barcelona will reportedly look to strengthen their defense and attack in the summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 123 Dead In Heavy Rain Due To Cyclone Ditwah In Sri Lanka
content: Torrential rains and floods triggered by Cyclone Ditwah have killed 123 people across Sri Lanka so far, with another 130 still missing, the Disaster Management Centre said Saturday.

title: 54 Flights Cancelled, Schools Shut: Cyclone Ditwah Affects Tamil Nadu
content: With Cyclone Ditwah steadily advancing towards the north Tamil Nadu and Puducherry coasts, authorities have stepped up preparedness on multiple fronts, from large-scale relief operations to flight cancellations and district-wide holiday notifications

title: Explained: India's Operation Sagar Bandhu In Sri Lanka
content: India has launched Operation Sagar Bandhu, a Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) initiative, to support Sri Lanka after Cyclone Ditwah triggered severe flooding, landslides and disruption across the island nation.

title: Siddaramaiah-DK Shivakumar's Big Unity Show After Karnataka Tussle
content: There is no problem between us, the two most important leaders in the Karnataka government said after sharing a power breakfast this morning.

title: Airlines In India Work On A-320 Fix After EU Agency's Critical Alert
content: Hundreds of Airbus aircraft flown by Air India and IndiGo were affected by an emergency airworthiness directive issued by the European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA).

title: Watch: 104 Skydivers From 20 Nations Form Mid Air Canopy Over US
content: A group of 104 skydivers from 20 different countries set a new world record by forming a mid-air canopy over Lake Wales, Florida. The record-breaking stunt, carried out on November 22, featured athletes creating a giant star-shaped pattern in the sky

title: Delhi Terror-Accused Doctors' Love Story And Slow Descent Into Terrorism
content: A doctor, two failed marriages, a newfound love and a slow descent into terrorism - that is the story of a 46-year-old woman, Shaheen Saeed, one of the key accused in the 10/11 blast near the iconic Red Fort in Delhi.

title: Explained: Why Airbus A320 Aircraft Are Undergoing Software Fix
content: The EASA issued an emergency airworthiness directive that temporarily grounds up to 6,000 Airbus A320 aircraft worldwide. This means that half of the global fleet of the world's best-selling airliner could be sidelined until there is a software fix.

title: NDTV Exclusive: "Ireland Backs Early India-EU Free Trade Deal," Says Ambassador Kevin Kelly
content: Ireland is "really optimistic" that the long-pending India-EU Free Trade Agreement can be concluded soon, with Dublin viewing the proposed pact as a "win-win" with transformative economic potential for both sides, Irish Ambassador to India said

title: Is Musk And Kamath's Podcast Promo AI-Generated? What Grok Says
content: Grok, X’s in-house chatbot, has cast doubt on a teaser featuring Elon Musk and Nikhil Kamath, suggesting the clip “appears to be AI-generated.”

title: DK Shivakumar And Siddaramaiah Meet For Power Breakfast - And A Transition
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar sat down for a quick, power breakfast with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah this morning.

title: BMWs, Mercedes, Land Rovers Seized During Raids In SBI Car Loan Fraud Case
content: In a crackdown against a vehicle loan fraud at State Bank of India, the Enforcement Directorate searched 12 residential and office premises of loan borrowers and car dealers in Pune and seized incriminating documents, an official said on Friday.

title: Hyderabad To Get State-Of-The-Art System To Solve Parking Issues
content: Hyderabad is preparing to launch a technologically advanced modern solution to address one of the most challenging traffic issues in urban India: parking your vehicle.

title: India Launches Op Sagar Bandhu, Sends Relief Material To Flood-Hit Sri Lanka
content: An Indian Air Force aircraft carrying emergency relief material for those displaced by unprecedented floods arrived in Sri Lanka early on Saturday morning.

title: Amid Power Tussle, Siddaramaiah-DK Shivakumar's Breakfast Meet Shortly
content: Amid an intense power tussle between Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his deputy, DK Shivakumar, both have received calls from the high command to put an end to the apparent rift, sources said.

title: "God Showed Up, Thought I Was Dead": Hilarious Pollution Song By Vir Das
content: Stand-up star and actor Vir Das woke up, took a deep breath and turned lyricist as he made a song about Mumbai's ever-thickening smog, blending pollution woes with his signature wit.

title: Black Friday Sees $8.6 Billion Online Sales As Shoppers Avoid Braving Cold
content: US shoppers spent $8.6 billion online on Black Friday, an Adobe Analytics report showed, as more consumers turned to laptops and phones instead of braving brisk weather to snap up deals during the holiday shopping weekend.

title: Cross-LoC Trade With PoK Is Intra-State Under GST Act: J&K High Court
content: Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh High Court has said the cross-Line of Control (LoC) trade between the Union territory and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir constitutes intra-state trade under the GST Act, as PoK is legally a part of J&K.

title: IndiGo, Air India Warn Of Flight Delays Over A320 Software Upgrade
content: IndiGo, Air India and Air India Express flight operations will see disruptions as they work on fixing a potential issue related to flight controls in their A320 family planes and 200-250 aircraft will be impacted in the country, according to sources.

title: 'Trump 2028, Yes': US President Hints At Running For 3rd Term With AI Image
content: US President Donald Trump drew attention after posting an AI-generated image on his Truth Social account showing him holding a blue sign that read "TRUMP 2028, YES!" The post was captioned "TRUMPLICANS!", a blend of "Trump" and "Republicans."
